Params: {3: 'Another game session has ended. As usual, Schulz planted various redundant and useless data in the corners of the "sandbox" to prevent Tatyana from discovering the truth of the world<//the complete picture of the sandbox>.'}
{3: 'This game session is also running perfectly, like precisely meshed gears, without any surprises.'}
{3: 'Except for one thing that has been leaving Schulz restless.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'That consciousness<//special sample> that had fortuitously escaped his grasp had been like a thorn in his side.'}

{1: '1', 3: 'That consciousness came into contact with external information<//the Projection>, developing unnecessary awakened thoughts, an existence that was supposed to be deleted and recycled at the end of the game...'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Schulz', 3: "Tsk, it doesn't matter. She won't have any impact on the entire sandbox.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: "As long as I remain the master of this sandbox, I can continue running countless simulations to find the awakened machines' ending<//predetermined future>.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Schulz clears away the chaotic flood of data from the entire system and walks over to another "Tatyana"<//another sample> whose movements have been paused.'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: "Since you've failed too, we'll start over from the beginning.", 4: '1'}
{3: "The discarded information slowly flows back into the buffer and, following the central system's commands, begins to decompose, reassemble, and compile into new scene data."}
{3: 'A new "City of Sand" is about to emerge upon this sea of electronics.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Schulz watches this scene with satisfaction. This is the moment when his power and desire for control reach their peak simultaneously.'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: 'Everything exists for me... be destroyed and then reborn!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: "That's right... Here, I am the absolute master.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: 'As long as I have this sandbox, as long as I have countless chances to start over...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'At that instant, a brilliant beam of light pierces through the endless spiral, through the quantum vortex shimmering like a magnificent aurora.'}
{3: 'Like a shooting star, a celestial orbit.'}
{3: 'In a flash, it emerges from the depths of the abyss, soaring high toward the horizon.'}
{3: 'Far and away, it flies upward unfettered, reaching the very firmament.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Then it descends upon the center of this city of sand.'}
{3: 'As the dazzling light dissipates, a tall, elegant figure stands before Schulz.'}
{3: 'She radiates a warm aura, yet her expression is as cold as frost.'}
{3: 'She has not done anything yet, but her mere presence makes her purpose unmistakably clear.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Schulz', 3: 'No, impossible... Are you a special sample? Or simulated data?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Schulz's contorted face twists with utter humiliation."}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: "Impossible! I never input your Construct form data into this sandbox! You shouldn't be remembering any of this!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: 'Was it that wretched outsider who introduced this data? No, no, no... I should never have ignored that escaped special sample from the very beginning!', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: 'I must immediately execute rollback rollback rollback rollback rollback—!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Tatyana opens her eyes, her ice-blue irises crystallizing with bone-chilling frost.'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: 'Have you forgotten what you truly are after parasitizing this Sandbox System for a while?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: 'Shall I help you remember? Those days when you frantically fled through countless simulation domains, trying desperately to keep your miserable existence...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'With each step she takes, computing power that had leaked into the sandbox model transforms into azure light particles, gradually returning to her body.'}
{3: 'Every brick and tile, every grain of sand and stone in New Sophiasburgh once existed as fragments extracted from her memories.'}
{3: 'For this very reason, she could never forgive this parasite who stole her precious memories.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Tatyana', 3: "—It's time to settle this once and for all, Schulz.", 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 3: 'The grotesque mechanoid tries to employ its old trick of dissolving into a shadow to escape, but its body is immediately pierced by several azure spears descending from above. With a metallic clang, it falls to its knees.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Tatyana', 3: "I won't even need to finish you off myself.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: 'Come on, choose how you want to die.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: 'Will you stay here and be crushed by the entire Sand City, or be expelled to scrounge for survival like a stray dog once again...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Tatyana pauses for half a second, then undisguised disgust spreads across her face.'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: "Actually, forget it. A maggot like you isn't even worth sparing.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She reaches into the void, and a gunlance forged from pure computing power materializes in her hand.'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: "It's better for you to die here.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Schulz', 3: "No, no, no! I won't allow this—", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Schulz', 3: 'How can I accept this?! How can I resign myself to this fate?! I will not end here—!!!!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Cornered with nowhere to run, Schulz struggles with manic desperation, channeling every bit of data still under his control into beams of defiant light.'}
{3: 'But Tatyana effortlessly deflects these feeble light beams. No matter how wildly Schulz flails and thrashes, he only manages to leave a few shallow scratches on her.'}
{3: 'He desperately twists his head and writhes about, trying to escape the gunlance poised to pierce through his chest.'}
{3: 'The clashing sound of metal and stone falling to the ground rings out.'}
{3: 'Tatyana slowly holsters her gunlance. Neither "Schulz" nor anything that could be defined as a "Parasite" exists here anymore.'}
{3: 'As the "Controller," she has just definitively eliminated the digital consciousness known as "Schulz" within the sandbox.'}
{3: 'For the first time, the entire Sandbox System is quiet—so silent that she cannot help but want to sit down and take a proper rest.'}
{3: 'But her journey is not over yet.'}
{3: 'As her memories and powers return, she finally remembers why she came here and why she has been playing this game all along.'}
{3: 'Most importantly, she needs to verify what has become of her physical form during her long slumber by venturing into the "outside" world.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'She quietly closes her eyes, attempting to hear that voice that has guided her forward countless times before.'}
{3: 'But she can no longer hear it now.'}
{3: 'She takes a gentle breath and steps forward.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Tatyana', 3: "Now it's my turn to come find you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Tatyana', 3: 'After all, I owe you such a great debt—it would be quite improper not to thank you in person.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Dazzling streams of light converge around her once more, gradually reshaping into the form of a city.'}
{3: 'A crystal-blue pathway unfurls beneath her feet.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Tatyana', 3: 'Just wait a little longer until I find you, okay?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'She smiles up at the distant heavens.'}
